definition: -ly/structural particle: used before a verb or adjective, linking it to preceding modifying adverbial adjunct

to draw (e.g. a bow)/to pull/to stretch sth/to extend/to lengthen/to involve or implicate in/to attract/to lead/to guide/to leave/to provide evidence or justification for/old unit of distance equal to 10 丈[zhang4], one-thirtieth of a km or 33.33 meters

sentences.english: Sheldon:Ah, gravity, thou are a heartless bitch.
sentences.chinese: 啊，地心引力，汝乃無良之婊子。

sentences.english: Gravity is tugging on my eyelids.
sentences.chinese: 地心引力不懈地拖曳着我的眼皮。

sentences.english: The law of gravity describes and quantifies the attraction between two objects .
sentences.chinese: 地心引力法則描述和量化了兩個物體間的吸引力。

sentences.english: Youth surge & Anti-gravity cream is a golden combination.
sentences.chinese: Youth浪湧&反地心引力的奶油是一個金黃組合。

sentences.english: In art I want to be free from the earth’s gravitational pull.
sentences.chinese: 在攝影作品中，我想脫離地心引力。

sentences.english: Well, the object has a certain mass, mg so there's a gravitational force on it, and the gravitational force equals mg.
sentences.chinese: 所以有地心引力，重力等於，這裏有一個阻力。

sentences.english: Another approach is to compute the gravitational forces involved.
sentences.chinese: 另一條路是去計算相關的地心引力。

sentences.english: When it does, gravity will cause the sun’s core to contract.
sentences.chinese: 當太陽能量耗盡，地心引力會使得太陽核心縮小。

sentences.english: She is a force of gravity in her long gray dress.
sentences.chinese: 灰色長裙下的她就像一股地心引力牢牢將他吸住。

sentences.english: A black hole is gravity gone mad, nothing can ever escape.
sentences.chinese: 黑洞等同於地心引力大失控，一切都難逃一劫。

sentences.english: Ah gravity, thou are a heartless bitch.
sentences.chinese: 啊，地心引力，你是一個無情無義的婊子。

definition: RMS Titanic, British passenger liner that sank in 1912
The Lord of the Rings by J.R.R. Tolkien 托爾金|托尔金[Tuo1 er3 jin1]
